summary: CLINTON claimed during the NY democratic debate on April 15th, 2016 that most of the guns used in crimes in New York come from out of state, specifically from states that do not have strong gun control measures like New York. CLINTON also mentioned that Senator Sanders made a commitment to the NRA in his 1990 campaign, where he promised to be against waiting periods for gun purchases.

SANDERS claims during the NY democratic debate on April 15th, 2016 that his tax returns from 2014 will be released, stating that they are "very boring" with no major investments or big money from speeches.
CLINTON claimed in the last sentence of this debate excerpt that the Sandy Hook families have the right to sue, and she supports them and anyone else who wants the right to sue.

CLAIM: CLINTON claims that the other side wants to privatize Social Security and turn over the Social Security Trust Fund to Wall Street.

This claim was made by CLINTON during the NY democratic debate on April 15th, 2016. CLINTON argues that the discussion is about the best way to raise money from wealthy people to extend the Social Security Trust Fund. She points out that the other side is calling Social Security a Ponzi scheme and wants to privatize it, which would involve turning over the Social Security Trust Fund to Wall Street.
During the NY democratic debate on April 15th, 2016, Sanders claims that he was responding to a previous point made by someone, despite the interruptions and cross-talk.

CLAIM: SANDERS claims that the minimum wage should be raised to $15 to end the starvation minimum wage of $7.25. 

This claim was made by SANDERS during the NY democratic debate on April 15th, 2016.

CLAIM: (APPLAUSE) CLINTON claims that there has not been a single question about a woman's right to make her own decisions about reproductive health care in the previous eight debates, and criticizes states and Donald Trump for restricting women's rights.
